OOC: Is there any known wherabouts of those two? If anyone remembers, Hollywood, Lurker and I used to be a little trio online. We were the nWo, both as a faction in this RPG and outside a group of good online friends. We did a lot together in other RPGs too, especially my many wrestling ones. I lost track of them though.

Kraftlos <kraftlos@...> wrote:                                  OOC: Sorry such a long time responding to this post.  I am interested in your history because I'm kinda trying to put together a history page on the wiki as a sort of side-project.  I'm a friend of THECODE or Hollywood Narrator as he was later called, though I haven't talked with him in about half a year.  I remember he used to be quite the arguer, he and Lurker_Abyss used to raise quite a ruckus at times.  (I haven't seen lurker online for at least 2 years).  Anyway, I'm interested in getting as much history as you're willing to provide! ^_^ 

Again, my apologies in the delay in getting your character active in the group.  [It's weird how long it takes to get stuff done over these groups ;-) ]




On 3/11/07,  hugar_twriker <hugar_twriker@...> wrote:                                    OOC: So would the best bet to introduce a new character or two to 
 just crash a shuttle?  Are we still on earth, and if so does the 
 earth look like todays earth or ancient earth and what time period 
 are we in?
 
 I did some research about all the times I have been here.  Well I was 
 one of the original founders(back when we didn't have a nifty yahoo 
 group and all that), I than came here as crow lord and was here from 
 April 25th, 2000 till August 29th, 2000.  I than came back as Beast 
 Wars(generic I know) and used that name from June 5th 2001 till July 
 18th, 2001 when my email messed up.  I than changed names to Hugar 
 Twriker and used that one from July 19th, 2001 till Feb. 27th, 2003 
 with breaks from March 18th, 2002 till July 6th, 2002 and July 21st, 
 2002 till  Feb. 4th, 2003.  Two things of note would be my feud with 
 THECODE and also I was on the council at one point.  I don't know, I 
 found my history interesting but doubt you care.
 
 --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@...> wrote:
 >
 > OOC: Hey, welcome back. I believe I remember that name. Good to see 
 an old time come back. I just returned as well.
 > 
 > Kraftlos <kraftlos@...> wrote:                                  
 OOC: WOW! Welcome back!  I vaguely remember that name, you were
 >  probably here right when I started but I'm not sure.  The last few
 >  months we've been working on an NBW wiki that i have found to be a
 >  really easy way to keep track of plot info. It can be reached by
 >  searching: NBWRPG wiki   on google.   It's the first link on the 
 list.
 >   :-)
 >  
 >  the parts about the working of the group are still a bit weak, but
 >  that should be a good plot update.   i dont think we have formal
 >  character creation procedures right now, so anything reasonable 
 should
 >  be fine. I can give you current events if you need me to.. but i 
 gotta
 >  get off the email for now.   Welcome back!
 >  
 >  On 3/10/07, hugar_twriker <hugar_twriker@...> wrote:
 >  > OOC:
 >  > I don't know how many of you remember me, but I am back.  I 
 think it
 >  > has been since like 4 years since I last been here.
 >  >
 >  > For those that don't remember me it is I Hugar, for those 
 history buffs
 >  > you might remember me by another name Proto_b, one of the 
 original
 >  > founders.
 >  >
 >  > As you might imagine, coming back after four years can be a huge
 >  > overload of information.  If anyone would be kind enough to fill 
 me it
 >  > that would be swell.  For example, is there a homepage anymore?  
 How do
 >  > I create a character?  Yadda Yadda Yadda?  It might be a lot to 
 tell so
 >  > in order not to create to many messages it might be best to 
 contact me
 >  > on yahoo messanger at hugar_twriker, MSN at kmaddo3@..., or AIM 
 at
 >  > thecrowlord. Of course if you want I guess you can just reply to 
 this
 >  > meassage.
 >  >
 >  > Thanks a lot,
 >  >
 >  > Hugar
 >  >
 >  >
 >  
 >      
 >                        
 > 
 >
